item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。就业报告发布前，美国股市和债券走势疲软。墨西哥比索下跌。反垄断监管机构对微软和英伟达展开调查。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US equities and bonds lose steam before jobs report. Mexico’s peso drops. Antitrust regulators open investigation into Microsoft and Nvidia. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 离岸人民币远期汇率下滑，推动中国人民银行放松控制的讨论
item.description: 离岸人民币的大量涌入扰乱了远期市场近期的动态，为官员们正在放松对管理货币的控制以允许其下跌的论点火上浇油。【原文：A flood of yuan offshore is disrupting a recent dynamic in the forward market, adding fuel to the argument that officials are loosening their grip on the managed currency to allow it to decline.】

item.title: 超级富豪家族推动 200 亿美元私募股权收购潮
item.description: 身价超过 1,500 亿美元的超级富豪和家族正在帮助推动私募股权收购的复苏，为本年度最大的一些收购提供资金，以克服艰难的交易环境。【原文：Ultra-rich individuals and families worth more than $150 billion are helping drive a resurgence in private equity buyouts, providing capital for some of the year’s biggest acquisitions to overcome a tough dealmaking environment.】

item.title: 中国 2 万亿美元股票大涨吸引全球基金持币观望，尽管风险重重
item.description: 一直对中国持观望态度的全球基金经理们又开始涉足中国市场。【原文：Global fund managers who’d been holding back on China are wading back in.】

item.title: 美国就业前景不明，亚洲股市开盘谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 由于华尔街在关键的美国就业数据公布前摇摆不定，亚洲股市准备试探性开盘。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for a tentative open as Wall Street wavered ahead of a key US jobs reading that will likely guide the interest rate outlook of the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 派博桑德勒将收购 Aviditi 以拓展私募股权投资业务
item.description: 派博桑德勒公司（Piper Sandler Cos.）已同意收购专注于另类投资的投资银行 Aviditi Advisors，以寻求扩大其在私募股权业务方面的服务。【原文：Piper Sandler Cos. has agreed to acquire alternatives-focused investment bank Aviditi Advisors as it seeks to expand its services in the private equity business.】

item.title: 科氏更改公司名称以反映其多元化发展
item.description: 美国第二大紧密型企业科氏工业公司（Koch Industries Inc.【原文：Koch Industries Inc., the second-largest closely held firm in the US, is changing its name after nearly six decades, along with its corporate structure.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利资本国际公司（MSCI）称韩国卖空机会 "每况愈下
item.description: 据 MSCI 公司称，韩国的卖空机会正在 "恶化"。【原文：South Korea’s short-selling accessibility is “deteriorating,” according to MSCI Inc.】

item.title: 澳大利亚小麦出口受阻，原因是天气干燥导致田地干枯
item.description: 西澳大利亚州是小麦出口量最大的州，该州的小麦生产受到天气影响，库存量不断减少，这将限制该国明年的主食出口量，使全球供应更加紧张。【原文：Weather-hit wheat production in Western Australia, the top exporting state, and dwindling stockpiles will limit the amount of the staple the nation can export in the coming year, further straining global supplies.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下 Encore 正在商谈 28 亿美元的私人融资计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 正与私人信用贷款机构洽谈，为其视听及活动服务公司 Encore Group USA LLC 筹集多达 28 亿美元的资金，以应对其即将到期的债务。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is in talks with private credit lenders to raise as much as $2.8 billion in financing for its audio-visual and event-services company Encore Group USA LLC to address its upcoming maturities, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通、花旗在就业数据公布前坚守 7 月美联储降息预期
item.description: 华尔街最后一批对美国 7 月降息持保留态度的人正准备迎接最明确的信号，以确定他们或市场交易员对美联储货币政策可能的走向是否正确。【原文：Wall Street’s last holdouts for a US interest-rate cut in July are preparing for their clearest sign yet on whether they — or traders in the market — are correct about the likely path of Federal Reserve monetary policy.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的 Lisa Shalett 认为美股将进一步上涨
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的丽莎-沙利特（Lisa Shalett）认为，2024 年下半年股市将继续上行，尽管在 1 月份以来的两位数上涨之后，上行速度将有所放缓。【原文：The stock market will continue its uptrend in the second half of 2024, albeit at a slower pace following a double-digit run since January, according to Morgan Stanley’s Lisa Shalett.】

item.title: 执政党誓言通过改革，墨西哥比索暴跌
item.description: 在下议院执政党领导人表示立法者将寻求通过安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔总统提出的一系列改革方案后，墨西哥比索下挫。【原文：Mexico’s peso sank after the leader of the ruling party in the lower house said lawmakers would seek to pass a swath of reforms proposed by President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.】

item.title: 杜斯特拥有的纽约公寓大楼获得新股权和债务
item.description: 纽约开发商 Durst Organization 为长岛市的一栋公寓楼 Sven 获得了新的股权和债务。【原文：New York developer Durst Organization secured new equity and debt for a Long Island City apartment building, Sven.】

item.title: EQT 支持的 Waystar 考虑将首次公开募股定价定在中档左右
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，医疗支付软件制造商 Waystar Holding Corp. 正在考虑将其首次公开募股的定价定在市场区间的中点附近。【原文：Health-care payments software maker Waystar Holding Corp. is considering pricing its initial public offering around the midpoint of its market range, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Authentic Brands 利用贷款市场削减成本，为收购提供资金
item.description: Authentic Brands 集团正在寻求削减一笔 33 亿美元贷款的利息成本，并额外借贷 4 亿美元为收购提供资金，这是最新一家利用风险债务市场的公司。【原文：Authentic Brands Group is seeking to slash the interest costs on a $3.3 billion loan and borrow an additional $400 million to fund an acquisition, marking the latest company to capitalize on a receptive market for risky debt.】

item.title: 赫兹考虑出售 7 亿美元担保债务及可转换债券
item.description: 据知情人士透露，赫兹全球控股公司（Hertz Global Holdings Inc.【原文：Hertz Global Holdings Inc., seeking to bolster its balance sheet after an electric-vehicles blunder, is considering the sale of at least $700 million in secured debt as well as a convertible notes offering, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 债券持有人就瑞士信贷AT1债券在美国起诉瑞士
item.description: 瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse Group AG）的债券在瑞士政府斡旋的交易中被瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）解救，导致其损失惨重，一群投资者正在美国法院起诉这个欧洲国家。【原文：A group of investors in Credit Suisse Group AG bonds that got wiped out when UBS Group AG rescued the bank in a Swiss government-brokered deal are suing the European country in a US court.】

item.title: 交通谈判陷入僵局，多伦多通勤者准备周五罢工
item.description: 多伦多市政府与工会组织的公交工人之间的劳资谈判在罢工前几小时陷入僵局，罢工可能会影响加拿大人口最多城市的 150 多万乘客。【原文：Labor talks between the City of Toronto and unionized transit workers have stalled hours before a strike that threatens to disrupt more than 1.5 million commuters in Canada’s most populous city.】

item.title: 逾期债务激增，特拉菲古拉头痛 17 亿美元
item.description: 大宗商品贸易巨头特拉菲古拉集团（Trafigura Group）的稳健利润掩盖了表面之下的不寻常之处：一大批客户已经停止付款。【原文：A solid headline profit for commodity trading giant Trafigura Group masked something unusual beneath the surface: a significant chunk of its customers have stopped paying.】

item.title: Aval 首席执行官敦促哥伦比亚降低 "过高 "的利率
item.description: 哥伦比亚最大的银行集团负责人表示，哥伦比亚应降低利率，以重振经济和受创的建筑业。【原文：Colombia should slash interest rates to reactivate the economy and its battered construction sector, according to the head of the nation’s biggest banking group.】

item.title: 咖啡价格上涨，Folgers 的所有者面临更高的成本
item.description: J.M. Smucker Co.旗下品牌包括 Folgers、Café Bustelo 和 Dunkin'，由于公司面临咖啡成本上升，该公司将提高咖啡价格。【原文：J.M. Smucker Co., whose brands include Folgers, Café Bustelo and Dunkin’, is set to hike prices as the company faces higher coffee costs.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 正在洽谈上市前一轮融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在当前数字资产市场大涨期间，Kraken 收到了潜在投资者的询价，因此这家历史最悠久的加密货币交易所正在考虑在可能的首次公开募股之前进行最后一轮融资。【原文：Kraken, one the oldest cryptocurrency exchanges, is considering raising a final funding round ahead of a possible initial public offering after receiving inquiries from potential investors during the current digital-asset market rally, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 随着工业去碳化，铝市场将迎来废铝潮
item.description: 随着铝行业面临更多的去碳化压力，回收金属将推动全球市场掀起一股大规模的铝浪潮。【原文：Recycled metal will drive a massive wave of aluminum that’s about to hit global markets, as the industry comes under more pressure to decarbonize.】

item.title: 私人信贷及其投资者担心黄金时代已逝
item.description: 在柏林举行的超级回报国际会议（SuperReturn International）上，交易商们正在走廊和木屋里开会，争取新的业务。他们也在排练如何回答最近经常听到的一个问题：1.7 万亿美元的私人信贷市场的繁荣时期是否已经过去？【原文：In hallways and wooden huts dotted around the SuperReturn International conference in Berlin, dealmakers are meeting to drum up new business. They’re also rehearsing answers to a question they’re hearing a lot these days: are the boom times for the $1.7 trillion private credit market over?】

item.title: 美国银行称，忘掉美国收益率曲线的赌注，转而关注加拿大
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）表示，随着国债收益率曲线继续发出有史以来最长的警告，押注加拿大利率变化是更好的选择。【原文：As the Treasury yield curve continues to flash its longest-ever warning, Bank of America Corp. says betting on rate shifts in Canada is the better play.】

item.title: 美国股市历来不会在六月份创出年内新高
item.description: 在过去的四十年里，六月从来都不是美股创下年内新高的月份。【原文：Over the past four decades, the month of June has never been the place where US stocks make their highs for the year.】

item.title: 吉普制造商考虑在南非生产新能源汽车
item.description: Stellantis NV 将于本月开始在南非建设第一家汽车厂，该公司正在考虑扩大在南非生产所谓的新能源汽车。【原文：Stellantis NV, which will start building its first auto plant in South Africa this month, is considering expanding into the production of so-called new-energy vehicles in the country.】

item.title: 拉加德不愿降息令市场猜测欧洲央行下一步行动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行兑现了降息承诺，但同时表示通胀率达到 2% 需要更长的时间，这让投资者对政策的下一步走向产生了疑问。【原文：The European Central Bank delivered on its promise to cut interest rates but left investors querying where policy is headed next by also saying it will take longer for inflation to reach 2%.】

item.title: 美国将迎来热浪，玉米创三周来最大涨幅
item.description: 芝加哥玉米涨幅高达 2.8%，创下自 5 月 10 日以来的最大盘中涨幅，因为美国新兴作物将首次面临高温威胁。【原文：Chicago corn rose as much as 2.8%, the biggest intraday gain since May 10, as the emerging US crop was set to face its first heat threat.】
